subnotes.content: This separate allocation engaged a number of institutions to study "the ecological factors promoting or hindering healthy development to justify the recommendation of particular child-care policies and programs." A major consultant in this program was Dr. Urie Bronfenbrenner of Cornell University, who designed a research program to gather epidemiologic and demographic data to reveal the effect of ecological and environmental factors upon developmental health. The first policy study group met on October 3, 1972, to discuss the parameters of this research project; an Advisory Committee next met on March 14, 1973, to propose the adoption of Dr. Bronfenbrenner's approach and outline objectives and criteria for research proposals. Adopting a multi-institutional approach, the Advisory Committee reviewed proposals for endeavors of one to three years.
The institutions selected for participation are individually documented in this subseries.
